comment.body: The ** syntax requires `provider_settings` to be a `dict` with `str` key, but you didn't validate `login_providers_raw`, how could you sure that `provider_settings` is of correct type?

issue.title: Code refers to some undefined settings key

type.name: Feature
type.description: A request, idea, or new functionality

issue.body:
<!-- Please only create issues for bug reports. Feature requests or general questions should start as a "Discussion" on GitHub. -->

**Describe the bug**

Sometimes we see logs like this:

```
eventyay.eventyay_common.tasks.create_world[368ad1b4-e7c5-42a5-8b69-843fc1b91214] raised unexpected: AttributeError("'Settings' object has no attribute 'VIDEO_SERVER_HOSTNAME'")
```

It is because some parts of our code are trying to use some settings which don't exist. We need to review case by case and do either:
- Copy missing settings from old eventyay-xxx code, or pretix, pretalx.
- Delete the code which uses that settings, if that code is not relevant.

**Tips**

To list the existing settings, run this in Django shell:

```py
>>> from pathlib import Path
>>> from django.conf import settings
>>> names = sorted(n for n in dir(settings) if n[0].isupper())
>>> Path('/tmp/defined-settings.txt').write_text('\n'.join(names))
```

It will dump the settings name to _/tmp/defined-settings.txt_ file.

To scan for which settings key that our code is trying to use, run this in Nushell, you also need to have `ripgrep` installed:

```nu
 let scanned_settings = rg '\bsettings\.[_A-Z]+' -t py -g !migrations --only-matching --no-line-number --no-filename | lines
 $scanned_setting | str replace 'settings.' '' | sort | uniq | where ($it | str length) > 1 | save /tmp/scanned-settings.txt
```
The list of settings keys will be dumped to  _/tmp/scanned-settings.txt_ file.

comment.body: @avinxshKD It is still available, you should run the commands in the instruction above to see if there is any dangling setting key.

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -447,6 +525,21 @@ def autodoc_skip_member(app, what, name, obj, skip, options):
     return skip
 
 
+def autodoc_process_docstring(app, what, name, obj, options, lines):
+    # Avoid reST treating "EVY_" as a reference target ("Unknown target name: evy").
+    for i, line in enumerate(lines):
+        if 'EVY_' in line:
+            lines[i] = line.replace('EVY_', '``EVY_``')
+
+        # Avoid ambiguous python-domain cross-references for the bare word
+        # "datetime" inside `:type:`/`:rtype:` fields. In this codebase, many
+        # docstrings use ":type foo: datetime" as a shorthand, and Sphinx
+        # attempts to resolve it against documented members named "datetime".
+        if line.lstrip().startswith((':type ', ':rtype:')) and 'datetime' in line:

review.body:
There are too many dirty hacks.
Should be reworked after #1849

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -55,7 +78,14 @@ def patched_getattribute(self, name):
 # Configure Django and override LOGGING settings for documentation builds
 # This must be done AFTER django.setup() to avoid triggering early settings initialization
 try:
-    django.setup()
+    # Some settings code expects the process CWD to be the project root.
+    # Temporarily chdir so documentation builds don't require app-side hacks.
+    _old_cwd = Path.cwd()
+    try:
+        os.chdir(Path(__file__).resolve().parent.parent)
comment.body:
This is dirty hack.
You shouldn't need it because `uv` can install our project to Python path.

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -14,20 +14,43 @@
 
 import os
 import sys
+import types
+from pathlib import Path
+import re
 
 # If extensions (or modules to document with autodoc) are in another directory,
 # add these directories to sys.path here. If the directory is relative to the
 # documentation root, use os.path.abspath to make it absolute, like shown here.
 
 sys.path.insert(0, os.path.abspath('../app'))
 
+# Python 3.14 removed the stdlib `cgi` module, but some transitive deps still
+# import it for `cgi.parse_header`. Provide a tiny stub during docs builds.
+if 'cgi' not in sys.modules:
comment.body: We should remove the dependency which is not compatible with Python 3.13, rather than to fake the `cgi` module.

issue.title: Replace bleach with nh3
issue.body:
Bleach is [deprecated](https://github.com/mozilla/bleach/issues/698).
Use [nh3](https://pypi.org/project/nh3/) as faster alternative (already in dependencies list).

comment.body:
@VijayabaskarR-06 We don't explictly assign because people often get busy after being assigned and let the task stuck. You just start working and create draft PR to let others know that you are working on it.

Please also not use all-uppercase.
